article.title: Change Management as Practice
article.subtitle: Simple, fundamental messages win when we're purposeful about finding common interest and learning to vibe with contextual background noise.

sections.title: The Myth of Perfect Process
sections.content: I've seen Fortune 500 companies spend months crafting the "perfect" change management framework, only to watch it crumble when it meets the reality of how people actually work. The truth is that sustainable transformation happens when you solve human problems, not just business problems.

sections.title: Finding Common Ground
sections.intro: The best change agents I know don't try to eliminate organizational background noise—they learn to work with it.
principles: Start with shared problems, not solutions
Listen to resistance as valuable data

sections.title: Case Study: Design System Adoption at USAA
sections.problem: When we needed to get 50+ development teams to adopt a new mobile design system, the traditional approach would have been to build perfect documentation, mandate adoption, and measure compliance.
approach: Found the team with the biggest pain point our system could solve
Let them become advocates to peer teams
Built adoption through peer influence rather than mandates
sections.result: 80% adoption in 6 months vs. the projected 18-month rollout through traditional change management.
